@mjsax, can you please explain the issue and how this helps?

@ijuma see my adjustment and comment in the code. Moved the wait inside the test method, this seems to really just be about the slow start. No need to hide the wait inside the send and cause confusion imo :)

Addition of REST configuration in connect-distributed.properties config file
@gwenshap @ewencp - Please review.

Thanks for your comment @ijuma.

Are you suggesting to use scala-logging with making all logging code prefixed by `logger.`? 
In case, yes, it solves the logging location problem that I want to solve.
If others have no complains about get rid of helper methods provided by kafka's Logging trait, that's the best I think :)

Anyways, I turns out that my patch doesn't work with scala2.12 at all since there was a breaking changes in call stack as newer scala uses default method to compile traits. Also after a few days of thinking I'm now thinking this solution was too tricky.
Let me close this PR once and consider different way, but please leave your thought about the above issue so I can take the next action ;)

@hachikuji Can you please review the latest patch?

@ijuma Thanks for the suggestions. 

1. It is a batch. The producer already uses `RecordBatch`, but maybe we could commandeer that name? I'm not too fond of `LogRecordsList`. It's a bit tough to come up with something reasonable given the name of `Records`. I'd rename that personally to something which conveyed the fact that it was a sequence of bytes of the log (but of course I already tried that and failed).

2. `DefaultLogEntry` sounds good to me. No strong preference between `OldLogEntry` and `LegacyLogEntry`. But perhaps "legacy" is a bit more suggestive of its use.

The other thing I wanted to mention is that I've left around the old `Record` class more or less as it currently is. This is why I needed to introduce the `LogRecord` interface. This seemed fine given use of the "log" prefix in `LogEntry`, but I've considered several times moving the current `Record` into `OldLogEntry`, and then using `Record` in place of `LogRecord`. What do you think?

`AdminClient` is already used by `core` (https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/KAFKA-3265) - so not sure if the same name is a good choice.  This raised the question, if we (at some point) could get rid of `StreamKafkaClient` and use `AdminClient` only?

I like the `KafkaClientSupplier` idea, however, this will require a KIP.

I'm not fond of `LogRecordsList` either, in case it was not clear from my message. :) I was thinking that maybe we could rename the existing `RecordBatch` to `ProducerBatch` or something.

Yes, I prefer `Legacy` a bit for the reason you state.

I think it makes sense to rename `LogRecord` to `Record`. The current Record could then either be moved to `LegacyLogEntry` (already using this name ;)) or it could just be `LegacyRecord`.

Refer to this link for build results (access rights to CI server needed): 
https://builds.apache.org/job/kafka-pr-jdk8-scala2.11/1981/
Test PASSed (JDK 8 and Scala 2.11).
@ijuma Updated the description.

So if we follow those suggestions, then we have the following hierarchy:
```
Records -> [RecordBatch]
RecordBatch -> [Record]
```
That seems reasonable to me. The `RecordBatch` -> `ProducerBatch` renaming will probably cause some confusion, but people will get over it.

Thanks for the patch.

As this is a public API change, it's required to prepare a KIP and JIRA for it: https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/KAFKA/Kafka+Improvement+Proposals
It's not a minor change :)
@junrao, what do you think?
